title: The Breach Goes On: Bury the Survivors Hub
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:blankstyle fade=a]]

[[module css]]
.document {
    background: white;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
    margin: 26px auto 0;
    max-width: 550px;
    padding: 24px;
    margin-bottom: 36px;
    position: relative;
    width: 80%;
}
.document:after {
    content: "";
    height: 98%;
    position: absolute;
    width: 100%;
    z-index: -1;
}
.document:before {
    background: #fafafa;
    box-shadow: 0 0 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
    left: -5px;
    top: 4px;
    transform: rotate(-2.5deg);
}
.document:after {
    background: #f6f6f6;
    box-shadow: 0 0 3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
    right: -3px;
    top: 1px;
    transform: rotate(1.4deg);
}
[[/module]]

[[>]]
[[module rate]]
[[/>]]


[[=image BTScover.jpg]]

----

[[=]]
//Remember, remember//
//The eighth of September//
//Remember catastrophe one//
//The sewers exploded//
//And time was eroded//
//And so began our fun//
[[/=]]

----

On 8 September 2002, [[[SCP-5243 | all heaven and hell breaks loose at Site-43]]]. The world's largest anomalous waste processing plant goes critical, and the fabric of time and space is forever bent backward around it. There will never be another 6:21 PM to 6:27 PM on 8 September at Site-43 again. They'll be reliving those six minutes annually for decades to come. That's the long-term issue; in the short term, there's the small matter of the eight dead people and the severe structural damage and the psychological trauma and, oh yeah, the question of why it happened in the first place.

Hopefully they'll have it sorted out before they need to start saving the world.

----

[[=]]
[[collapsible show="Seven Strangers" hide="Seven Strangers"]]
//V.L. Scout dug our abode//
//Where gods descend to die//

//Ibanez walks a crooked road//
//That leads where horrors lie//

//Poor Okorie lonely waits//
//Within her skein of sand//

//While Blank// et al //digest their fates//
//Commingle, then disband//

//Deep run Lillihammer's roots//
//And deeper still her dreams//

//Al McInnis frets the stage//
//While backstage, something screams//

//Willie Wettle 'round their necks//
//They take a break to have some sex//

//Before the final curtain call//
//Home truths for Nascimbeni//

//Once where seven strangers stood//
//Will now stand **far too many**.//
[[/collapsible]]
----
